description: Unique surrogate identifier for the top‑level organizational entity in the fleet hierarchy.
System timestamp of the last insert or update (likely yyyymmddhhmmssmmm); used for auditing and synchronization. Confirm timezone and precision with SME.
Boolean flag indicating the entity is inactive or retired and should be hidden from operational lists.
Fax number for the organization or location contact.
Primary telephone number for the organization or location contact.
Postal or ZIP code for the entity’s address.
City for the entity’s mailing or physical address.
Secondary address line, such as suite, building, or apartment.
Primary street address line for the entity.
Business name or title of the top‑level organizational group in the fleet hierarchy.
Numeric code for the top‑level group, used as a business identifier or ordering key; confirm uniqueness rules with SME.
Website URL for the organization or location.
Free‑text notes or comments about the organizational entity.
Binary image or logo associated with the entity (stored as a blob).
Primary email address for the organization or contact.
Reference to state/province of the address, likely a code or foreign key to a lookup; confirm code set.
Human‑readable state or province text corresponding to the coded state field; likely denormalized for display. Confirm mapping.
Identifier for this entity in a legacy source system, used for migration and cross‑reference.
Name of the legacy source table or system that issued the legacy key.
Flag or identifier for integration with a specific external system/device; 0/1 or external ID expected. Meaning is unclear; confirm with SME.
Descriptive text or status string associated with the external system integration field; likely used for display. Confirm usage.
